captions.text: Second Wind
[Intro Music]

E3 may be dead - or at least, no one&#39;s shoved 
a broom handle up its decaying arse to make it

dance horrifyingly around lately - but that hasn&#39;t 
stopped the big publishers from dropping their

showcases of new game trailers at around the same 
time of year, possibly by the same principle the

zombies in Dawn of the Dead kept showing up to the 
mall out of some vague understanding that it was

something that was important to them in life. And 
so even in the post-E3 post-ZP world I must once

again accept my solemn duty to widdle all over 
the big money industry&#39;s sandwiches. Don&#39;t worry,

I&#39;ve got plenty of widdle stored up, in fact, 
your own artisanal sourdough looks like it could

use a little moistening, gaming public, because 
I&#39;m very disappointed in the shortness of your

memories. You remember we&#39;re supposed to be down 
on triple A game development right now? &#39;Cos it&#39;s

basically an industrial dream crushing machine 
for ambitious STEM graduates that pounds them

into mush for the sake of making bland overpriced 
shite marginally prettier, then shuts down their

studio anyway because apparently making good games 
that turn a profit isn&#39;t enough to appease the

corporate overlords anymore and they&#39;d&#39;ve had as 
much luck trying ritualistic chicken sacrifice.

Remember that? Remember how mad you got? But 
then oh, Xbox dropped a few trailers showing

how realistically the light plays off the oiled 
nipples of its upcoming dream crushing machine

and so the media rolled onto its back and offered 
to lick the bits of game developer brain off their

fucking boots. This shit hasn&#39;t gotten any 
more sustainable now that the prisoners in

the Ubisoft programming dungeons - the Ubliette, 
if you will - are making &quot;the first open world

Star Wars game.&quot; And oh crikey when the Star Wars 
Outlaws gameplay trailer started with those words,

I can&#39;t have been the only one who immediately 
started searching their memory. Jedi Survivor?

Soulslike. Arguable, really. Ooh! MMOs, there 
we go. What&#39;s Star Wars The Old Republic, then,

Ubisoft, a puddle of poodoo on a hot paving 
slab? Anyway, Star Wars Outlaws - or Star Cry

as I shall dismissively call it - looks like yet 
another Ubisoft open world stamped out of the Far

Cry template with a million competing mechanics 
and zero focus, pounded into flavourlessness and

stretched out for as broad appeal as possible 
like a piece of chewing gum in the hands of a

bored high school student. I look forward 
to it continuing the pattern for Star Wars

media these days: everyone forgetting all 
about it roughly a month after release.

The other thing Ubisoft had was Assassin&#39;s Creed 
Shadows, the first ever Assassin&#39;s Creed game set

in Japan, besides the other one. Yeah, now I see 
why Sony released Ghost of Tsushima on Steam the

other week - they&#39;ll never do that with their 
exclusives to be nice or because it would earn

them money, if they did Bloodborne and Infamous 
would be up there, but if that can&#39;t motivate

them there&#39;s always good old-fashioned spite, 
apparently. Ooh, Assassin&#39;s Creed with samurais,

is it? Shame we did that already. Yeah, Assassin&#39;s 
Creed Shadows, and just to repeat myself,

what does a new Assassin&#39;s Creed game even 
mean, any more? The overarching story stopped

being about anything roughly nineteen games ago, 
all they do now is dress up the stabbing of the

dudes in new historical reenactment costumes. I 
vaguely remember once joking, probably around the

time Assassin&#39;s Creed Revelations came out, 
that the series is just gonna go on until

they&#39;ve used every cliched sequel subtitle word 
they can think of, and it&#39;s nice to see that&#39;s

an evergreen snark. Thanks, Ubisoft, you&#39;re like 
the most productive cow in my organic snark farm,

I can always rely on you when I need to put 
some motherfucking yoghurt on the table.

Sony&#39;s State of Play was kinda pathetic, a couple 
of lacklustre announcements and a port or two,

and I always wonder why I haven&#39;t seen more 
of the Silent Hill 2 remake by now but then I

remember every time I try to watch footage of 
it I dry heave so hard my glasses fly off. So

Xbox are generally agreed to have quote &quot;won&quot; 
this year, after Arkane and Tango Gameworks

got shut down for not sacrificing their chickens 
properly or something Microsoft apparently hope to

weasel out of that loss of goodwill with a charm 
offensive, emphasis on &quot;offensive.&quot; Kinda feels

like a Deep South plantation owner saying &quot;Sorry 
we enslaved all those African people, but hey,

look at all this cotton you can buy from me 
now. Fuckin&#39; worth iiiit.&quot; So we have Doom:

The Dark Ages. It&#39;s Dark Fantasy Doom. Which 
I preferred when it was called Hexen. Which

I preferred when it was called Quake 1. Which 
I preferred when it was called Painkiller etc

etc. Am I the only one who reacted to the gun 
that shoots ground up skulls of your enemies

with &quot;Oh come the fuck on.&quot; What is it about 
the continued emphasis on the blank slate Doom

protagonist as unstoppable murder man that 
gives me mid-life crisis vibes? It&#39;s like

Breaking Bad with demon murder instead of meth. 
If the game over screen features a slow zoom

out from a splattered giblet with 70s rock music 
playing in the background you&#39;ll see what I mean.

Staying on the subject of shooters, Gears of War 
is demonstrating the best approach to take when

the last game&#39;s ending writes you into a corner, 
slam on that reverse gear and keep driving &#39;til

your car speeds straight off the pier at the 
end of prequel bay. For the first time we will

learn the real story of how the fight between 
mankind and the Locust truly began. I&#39;m guessing

it will involve mankind, right, getting into 
fights with some Locust. Lots of them. Like,

ten to fifteen hours of them, probably. Besides 
that much of the Xbox showcase was an exercise in

&quot;Here&#39;s name you recognise! It&#39;s on something 
you don&#39;t recognise at all! Psyche!&quot; So we&#39;ve

got a new Dragon Age whose trailer apparently 
thinks it&#39;s a magenta hero shooter, doing that

magenta thing where they display a character&#39;s 
name in a unique font and freeze frame on them

at the precise moment before a fist from off 
screen can very satisfyingly smash them in the

face. And count the number of times the gameplay 
trailer interrupts itself with a black screen and

&quot;let&#39;s skip ahead to the next story event!&quot; What 
do you think they cut out? Remember, they&#39;d show

you it if it&#39;d sell the game. So probably lots 
of grindy boring combat, I shouldn&#39;t wonder.

Also, here&#39;s a game called Perfect Dark and 
another game called Fable. And as for how they

relate to previous games called Perfect Dark and 
Fable, if they have a single individual developer

in common or if you can expect more of what 
you got from those games - side note let&#39;s hope

not because a decent percentage of what you got 
from them was a load of old wrinkly bumbags - or

which if any of the property&#39;s original creators 
stand to benefit from this exploitation of their

hard work we&#39;re dredging up from our giant 
bin of IPs we arrogantly claim to possess,

who the fuck cares, it&#39;s a name you recognise, 
get wishlisting you predictable fucking cows.

Oh hello Nintendo, you&#39;re here too, sorry, 
I thought you were busy playing with your

belly button fluff as always. Let&#39;s see what 
you&#39;ve got. Okay &quot;Brothership&quot; isn&#39;t a word,

but whatever. A new Zelda where you play 
as Zelda, maybe that&#39;ll finally clear up

the confusion my grandma always had. But wait 
here&#39;s the cherry: at long last, Metroid Prime

4. Beyond. And it looks like... a Metroid Prime 
game. I&#39;m sorry, I just can&#39;t summon enthusiasm.

Not for a 2025 release date and certainly not 
for that fucking subtitle. You&#39;ve been teasing

and denying this for too many years, Nintendo. 
I&#39;ve been chained to the bed so long I don&#39;t even

want you to finish sucking me off, I just wanna 
get some dinner. And I guess call the police.
